alert.note: Alert for Northern Scott County; Western and Northern Logan County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 8:08PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Logan and north central Scott Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burnville, or 12 miles southwest of Charleston. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mansfield... Echo... Barber... Lucas... Chismville... Glendale in Logan County... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for western Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Northern Scott County; Western and Northern Logan County
